subject: Re: [junit] Logs
msgSnippet: HI, One way is to use the TestResult object wherby u can store the result. The second way is to use the Ant  where a test report is provided. The test report
messageBody:
HI,

One way is to use the TestResult object wherby u can store the result.
The second way is to use the Ant where a test report is provided. The test report can even be mailed to someone if desired, using this. Its a xml based and simple to understand and execute. its called Jakarta-Ant-1.3.

With regards
Suresh.S







Quoting Sumeet.Sharma@...:

> I'm using junit3.6 framework .As i run a testcase , I expect a report (
> log
> file) to be created in the c:\junitLogs directory (I've created one in
> c: )
> . But no log file is being created even after successful testacase run
> !
> "c:\junitLogs" is also in the classpath ! What should I do to get junit
> log
> report ?
>
> -sumu
